channel.title: Offensive Security Posts on
channel.description: Recent content in Offensive Security Posts on

item.title: Low level computer concept
item.description: I found an exellent post on stackoverflow explaining the differences between opcode, bytecode, mnemonic, machine code and assembly.

item.title: How to check Memory Permission in Windbg
item.description: Using windbg we can check memory permission under Protect field.

item.title: How to disable access violation/guardpage in windbg
item.description: Command below disable access violation and guard pages in Windbg

item.title: Windbg useful commands
item.description: All windbg commands here # Link to windgb manual

item.title: Windbg, the cdb.exe to attach to process
item.description: This technique address the need to launch windbg with high privilege to debug processes running with system account privilege.

item.title: Find IAT using Windbg
item.description: You can find the Import Address Table of an application and the list of imported functions by attaching Windbg to the process and following the steps below.

item.title: TTY shells
item.description: My notes on some of useful tty commands # Color when listing files # export TERM=xterm-256-color alias ll='ls -lsahta --color=auto' Run: ll Get interactive shell zsh shell // new kalli version working # python3 -c 'import pty; pty.

item.title: Narly plugin for windbg
item.description: Narly is a plugin that parses the image and identifies the binary protections mechanisms enabled such as DEP, ASLR, SafeSEH and GS.

item.title: The IAT (Import Address Table)
item.description: The Import Address Table stores information about the loaded modules imported by the current running processs.

item.title: The RP++ ROP Finder
item.description: The rp++ is a ROP Gadget finder used by Exploit Developers to bypass DEP protection.

item.title: The TEB Structure
item.description: The TEB (Thread Environment Block) # Just as PEB contains information about the processs, the TEB has information about the thread running in the processs.

item.title: The PEB Structure
item.description: The PEB (Process Environment Block) # The PEB is a data structure that store information about the running process and can be accessed through intel x86 [FS] register at offset 0x30h.

item.title: Meterpreter Session Time out
item.description: A year ago while testing a https reverse meterpreter shell after a 15 or 30 minutes the meterpreter session would die.

item.title: Powershell Port Scan
item.description: While training Red Teaming or Penetration Test hacking on plataforms like Hack the Box or previous offensive security training like OSCP or OSEP
